titlestmt.titleproper: J. Walter Thompson Company. Frank Johnson commercials
Guide to the J. Walter Thompson Company. Frank Johnson commercials, 1973 and undated RL.11158
titlestmt.author: Richard Collier

publicationstmt.publisher: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2016-07-21 10:03:23 -0400.

repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

did.unittitle: J. Walter Thompson Company. Frank Johnson commercials
did.abstract: Founded in 1864, the J. Walter Thompson Company (JWT) is one of the oldest and largest enduring advertising agencies in the United States. Franklin C. Johnson served as Art Director and Creative Director for JWT and a number of other agencies.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Born July 11, 1918; attended Mizen Academy of Art 1938-1939; U.S. Army during World War II, rank of Sargeant; Art Director, Foote Cone & Belding 1946-1955; Art Director, Campbell-Mithun 1955-1956; Art Director, Maxon 1956; Art Director, Needham Louis & Borey 1956-1962. JWT Chicago: Art Director 1962; Vice President 1964; Creative Director 1967; resigned 1973.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Researchers must register and agree to copyright and privacy laws before using this collection.
All or portions of this collection may be housed off-site in Duke University's Library Service Center. The library may require up to 48 hours to retrieve these materials for research use.
Please contact Research Services staff before visiting the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library to use this collection.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The J. Walter Thompson Company. Frank Johnson commercials were received by the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library as a gift in 1997.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], J. Walter Thompson Company. Frank Johnson commercials, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Accessions described in this collection guide: 1997-0240

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Related materials may be found in the following JWT collections: Account Files, Domestic Advertisements.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: Consists of five reels of television commercials. Companies represented include Campbell Taggart Bakeries, Employers Mutual of Wausau, Kraft cheeses and Sears. Acquired as part of the John W. Hartman Center for Sales, Advertising & Marketing History.
